intro: Quaqua armata subsp. armata, commonly known as the Cape Harebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its arid environment. Quaqua armata subsp. armata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
